name: electricity production, hydro, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11543/documentation

This is a dataset used to create an aluminium industry specific electricity market for 'aluminium production Area 3' (South America). The production volume represents the total amount of hydroelectricity used in the region for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). The dataset also identifies the technology and country providing the hydroelectricity in the region. ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;All hydroelectricity assumed to be produced by tropical hydroelectric reservoir (known for Brazil, estimated for other countries).;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2015 data from IAI
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Aluminium producing South American countries (AR, BR, VE)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of hydroelectricity production to the respective technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage), shares of different types of hydroelectric plants in the countries, when available, were used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: IAI data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from hydroelectric plants. The cited 100% representativeness is for IAI data (data based on 100% of regional aluminium production). The percent representativeness of data used to determine that that hydroelectricity is from tropical reservoir plants is 85% (equal to share of BR hydroelectricity in total regional hydroelectricity for aluminium production). It is an assumption for other countries (AR, VE).

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology

flow.name: electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Calculated amount (see general comments).
0.8453 kWh are supplied from Brazilian tropical hydropower reservoirs. This amount is split over the different Brazilian grid areas according to their annual production volume of hydropower from tropical reservoirs.
BR-Mid-western grid: 13.08%	
BR-North-eastern grid: 7.79%	
BR Northern grid: 20.65%	
BR-South-eastern grid: 18.01%	
BR Southern grid: 40.47%
